metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4277 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Svnserve in Apache Subversion 1.4.0 through 1.7.12 and 1.8.0 through 1.8.1 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files or kill arbitrary processes via a symlink attack on the file specified by the --pid-file option.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libapache2-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-java - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-perl - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-ruby - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn1 - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
python-subversion - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
ruby-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
subversion - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
subversion-tools - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> pid file is not created by default on Ubuntu. This is only an issue if someone specifies a pid file in an insecure location. as such, we will not be fixing this.

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.13-2ubuntu2').
